Episodes.Title: Pilot
Episodes.Plot: Film-buff Dawson finds his best friend, Joey, growing jealous of his attraction to a neighbor's granddaughter. Meanwhile, pal Pacey falls in love with a mystery woman, who is really a teacher at Capeside.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Nicole Nieth, Mitchell Laurance, Leann Hunley, George Gaffney, Ed Grady, Ted King, Rick Forrester, Evan Kelly

Episodes.Title: Dance
Episodes.Plot: Dawson casts Jen as the new leading lady in his film, but creates a messy off-camera scene during her date at the school dance. Meanwhile, Joey confronts Mrs. Leery about her liaisons; and Pacey gets under Tamara's skin with his public flirting.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Nicole Nieth, Scott Foley, Leann Hunley, Mitchell Laurance

Episodes.Title: Kiss
Episodes.Plot: While working on the film class's movies, team player Dawson has a hard time being stuck in the background. Meanwhile as he plots to give Jen the "perfect kiss", Joey is swept away by a handsome stranger and Pacey tries to graduate to manhood.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Nicole Nieth, Obi Ndefo, Scott Foley, Ian Bohen, Leann Hunley, Mitchell Laurance, Angela Ray, Christopher Berry, Chris Blackwelder, Patrick Tucker, Jeremy D. Shepherd

Episodes.Title: Discovery
Episodes.Plot: Dawson turns to Jen after learning of his mom's affair, and Joey's knowledge of it. But he regrets doing so when she tells him some of her problems; meanwhile Pacey and Tamara continue to tempt fate with their fling.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Leann Hunley, Ed Grady, Travis Stanberry, Mitchell Laurance, Ric Reitz, Jeremy D. Shepherd

Episodes.Title: Hurricane
Episodes.Plot: When a major hurricane moves inland, all take refuge in the Leery home, where Dawson rages at Jen about her past, and Mitch storms out after learning of Gale's affair. That leaves a tormented Dawson to deal with their fallout. Meanwhile, Pacey ruins his brother's chances to get with Tamara at her beach house.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Dylan Neal, Obi Ndefo, Leann Hunley, Ric Reitz, Patt Noday

Episodes.Title: Baby
Episodes.Plot: Capeside is abuzz with rumors of a teacher's indiscretion, rumors that prove fateful for Pacey and Tamera. Meanwhile, Joey and Jen get a life lesson when Bessie is aided by an unlikely source when she gives birth in Dawson's living room.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.Writer: Jon Harmon Feldman, Joanne T. Waters
Episodes.GuestStars: Obi Ndefo, Dylan Neal, Leann Hunley, Christopher Berry, Chris Blackwelder, Josh Crouch, Dorothy Recasner Brown, Traci Dinwiddie, David Lenthall

Episodes.Title: Detention
Episodes.Plot: In what is said to be one of the best episodes, the gang, after committing various violations at school, gets stuck together for an 8 hour Saturday detention, where Dawson and Pacey turn against each another; and Joey offers a tearful partial explanation for her anger toward Jen.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Monica Keena, Helen Baldwin, Mati Moralejo, Mike Pniewski, Micah Leamer, Barry Bell, Lyndabeth Bureau, Adrienne Harvey, John Copeman, Alan Christy

Episodes.Title: Boyfriend
Episodes.Plot: Dawson feels the heat when Jen is visited by an old boyfriend; Joey lets off a bit too much steam at a beach party and ends up in a sticky situation; and tensions between Mitch and Gale reach the boiling point as they attempt to rebuild their marriage.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.Writer: Jon Harmon Feldman, Dana Baratta, Charles Rosin, Kar
Episodes.GuestStars: Scott Foley, Eion Bailey, Jeremy Moore, Paula Davis, John Copeman

Episodes.Title: Roadtrip
Episodes.Plot: Hoping to get over Jen, Dawson agrees to join Pacey and Billy in a boys night out and finds what he is looking for in another woman. Meanwhile Jen handles damage control after Joey becomes the subject of a rumor at school.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Monica Keena, Eric Balfour, Eion Bailey, Helen Baldwin, Melissa Suzanne McBride, Jessica Chappell, J.R. Rodriguez

Episodes.Title: Double Date
Episodes.Plot: A double date finds Jen and Cliff joined by Dawson and a savvy sidekick who calls him on a plot to make Jen jealous. But it's Dawson turn to turn green when Pacey grows close to Joey working on a project.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Violence, coarse language and sexual references
Episodes.GuestStars: Megahn Perry, Craig Edwards, Keith Flippen

Episodes.Title: The Scare
Episodes.Plot: In honor of Friday the 13th, Dawson, plans a s√©ance for the gang, they are all spooked by reports of a serial killer heading towards Capeside.
Episodes.GuestStars: Jennifer McComb, David Blanchard, Ed Grady, Patt Noday, Justin Smith, Dino Muccio

Episodes.Title: Beauty Contest
Episodes.Plot: Joey and Pacey enter a beauty competition; Jen regrets her breakup with Dawson.
Episodes.GuestStars: Lori Rom, Cara Stoner, Marguerite Lowell, Robby Preddy, Tara Killian, Courtney Fendley, G. Martin Eckhardt

Episodes.Title: Decisions
Episodes.Plot: In the season finale, Dawson and Joey confront their true feelings. Joey, visits her father in prison, and debates leaving to go to France.
Episodes.GuestStars: Ed Grady, Richard Fullerton, Helen Baldwin
